page.title: 03Alstonefield Landscape
page.content: Around Alstonefield, it is mostly farmland with rivers, fields and grassland. The land is quite hilly and the woodland is largely spread. The land next to the burial mound Steep Low, which is covered with trees, belongs to Gateham Farm. This land is mainly mowing grass used for hay and silage, with just a few pastures. The land on the other side of the road is mainly pasture and belongs to Gateham Grange. The land around Pealow belongs to Raikes Head Farm and Green Farm. This land is also mixed with some mowing grass and some pastures. The River Dove starts in the Axe Edge Moors as a little stream, flows east of Alstonefield and when it gets to Dove Dale it is a wide river. There are also one or two dried-up river beds in the area.
